required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Single-Session Computerized Mental Health Intervention for Rural Indian Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Effectiveness of a Computerized, School-Based, Single-Session Intervention for Rural Indian Adolescents

brief_summary.textblock: The overall aim of this project is to understand if single-session interventions are acceptable, culturally appropriate, and effective for Indian adolescents attending a rural, low-resource government school. The investigators will be examining the effects of a computerized intervention on the well-being and mental health of adolescents. The investigators hypothesize that the intervention will yield statistically significant improvements in wellbeing and mental health relative to a study skills control condition.

clinical_study.why_stopped: In collaboration with community partners, we determined that the reading level required for the intervention did not make it suitable for the adolescents.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in The Warwick-Edinburgh Mental Wellbeing Scale
primary_outcome.description: Well-being questionnaire. Total score ranges from 14 to 70. Higher values indicate a better outcome.

Questionnaire measuring the appropriateness of an intervention. Appropriateness refers to the perceived fit or relevance of an intervention. The total score ranges from 4 to 20. Higher scores indicate a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.description: Depression Questionnaire. The total score ranges from 0 to 27. Lower scores indicate a better outcome.

Anxiety Questionnaire. The total score ranges from 0 to 21. Lower scores indicate a better outcome. Anxiety Questionnaire. The total score ranges from 0 to 21. Lower scores indicate a better outcome. Anxiety Questionnaire. The total score ranges from 0 to 21. Lower scores indicate a better outcome. Anxiety Questionnaire. The total score ranges from 0 to 21. Lower scores indicate a better outcome. Anxiety Questionnaire. The total score ranges from 0 to 21. Lower scores indicate a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: The EPOCH Measure of Adolescent Well-being
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire with five subscales measuring engagement, perseverance, optimism, connectedness, and happiness. Each subscale score ranges from 4 to 20. Higher scores indicate a better outcome. The happiness and optimism subscales will be used as secondary outcomes for this trial. A total score is not computed.

Questionnaire measuring the acceptability of an intervention. Acceptability refers to the perception that a given treatment is agreeable or satisfactory. The total score ranges from 4 to 20. Higher scores indicate a better outcome.

Questionnaire measuring the feasibility of an intervention. Feasibility refers to the degree to which a treatment can be successfully implemented in a given setting. The total score ranges from 4 to 20. Higher scores indicate a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time Frame: Baseline, 4 week follow-up, 12 week follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Questionnaire measuring perceived stress. The total score ranges from 0 to 16. Lower scores indicate a better outcome.

intervention.description: Reading and writing activities based on growth (designed to instill the belief that people can change), gratitude (noticing and appreciating good things in life), and behavioral activation (identifying and scheduling positive activities).
Reading and writing activities designed to teach evidence-based study strategies.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Attending a participating secondary school
- Age 12 to 18
- Literate in English
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to provide informed consent
